DE_transcript: Kaum so viel, dürfte ich sagen.
EN_transcript: Hardly as much, I daresay.

EN_transcript: The painter stared in amazement.

EN_transcript: What had happened ?

EN_transcript: How long will you like me ?

EN_transcript: Lord Henry Wotton Is perfectly right.

EN_transcript: Youth is the only thing worth having.

EN_transcript: Hallward turned pale, and caught his hand.

EN_transcript: I have never had such a friend as you, and I shall never have such another.

DE_transcript: Du bist doch nicht eifersüchtig auf tote Dinge, wie?
EN_transcript: I have never had such a friend as you, and I shall never have such another.

DE_transcript: Ich bin eifersüchtig auf das Bild, das du von mir gemalt hast.
EN_transcript: I am jealous of the portrait you have painted of me.

EN_transcript: Why should it keep what I must lose ?

EN_transcript: Oh, if it were only the other way I If the picture could change, and I could be always what I am now Why did you paint it ?

EN_transcript: The hot tears welled into his eyes; he tore his hand away, and, flinging himself on the divan, he buried his face in the cushions, as though he was praying.

EN_transcript: It is the real Dorian Gray that is all.

EN_transcript: If it is not, what have I to do with it ?

EN_transcript: You should have gone away when I asked you, he muttered.

DE_transcript: Ich blieb, als du mich batest, war Lord Henrys Antwort.
EN_transcript: I stayed when you asked me, was Lord Henry's answer.

DE_transcript: Harry, ich kann nicht auf einmal mit meinen zwei besten Freunden streiten; aber ihr beide seid schuld, daß ich das schönste Werk, das ich je schuf, hassen muß, und ich will es vernichten.
EN_transcript: Harry, I can't quarrel with my two best friends at once, but between you both you have made me hate the finest piece of work I have ever done, and I will destroy it.

EN_transcript: What is it but canvas and colour ?

EN_transcript: I will not let it come across our three lives and mar them.

EN_transcript: Dorian Gray lifted his golden head from the pillow, and with pallid face and tearstained eyes looked at him, as he walked over to the deal paintingtable that was set beneath the high curtained window.

DE_transcript: Was wollte er tun?
EN_transcript: What was he doing there ?

DE_transcript: Seine Finger wühlten unter den herumliegenden Zinntuben und trockenen Pinseln, als suchten sie etwas.
EN_transcript: His fingers were straying about among the litter of tin tubes and dry brushes, seeking for something.

EN_transcript: Yes, it was for the long paletteknife, with its thin blade of lithe steel.

EN_transcript: He had found it at last.

EN_transcript: He was going to rip up the canvas.

EN_transcript: With a stifled sob the lad leaped from the couch, and, rushing over to Hallward, tore the knife out of his hand, and flung it to the end of the studio.

EN_transcript: <MERGE> It would be murder ! am glad you appreciate my work at last, Dorian, said the painter, coldly, when he had re covered from his surprise.

EN_transcript: I never thought you would.

EN_transcript: Appreciate it ?

EN_transcript: I am in love with it, Basil.

EN_transcript: It is part of myself.

EN_transcript: I feel that.

EN_transcript: Well, as soon as you are dry, you shall be var nished, and framed, and sent home.

EN_transcript: Then you can do what you like with yourself.

EN_transcript: And he walked across the room and rang the bell for tea.

DE_transcript: Du nimmst doch Tee, Dorian?
EN_transcript: You will have tea, of course, Dorian ?

DE_transcript: Du auch, Harry?
EN_transcript: And so will you, Harry ?

DE_transcript: Oder hast du etwas gegen so einfache Genüsse?
EN_transcript: Or do you object to such simple pleasures ?

EN_transcript: I adore simple pleasures, said Lord Henry.

DE_transcript: Sie sind die letzte Zuflucht des Komplizierten.
EN_transcript: They are the last refuge ef the complex.

EN_transcript: But I don't like scenes, except on the stage.

DE_transcript: Was für törichte Burschen ihr seid, alle beide!
EN_transcript: What absurd fellows you are, both of you I wonder who It was defined man as a rational animal.

DE_transcript: Ich möchte wissen, wer es gewesen ist, der den Menschen als vernünftiges Tier definiert hat.
EN_transcript: It was the most premature definition ever given.

EN_transcript: Man is many things, but he is not rational.

EN_transcript: I am glad he is not, after all : though I wish you chaps would not squabble over the picture.

EN_transcript: You had much better let me have it, Basil.

DE_transcript: Dieser törichte Knabe braucht es nicht wirklich; aber ich brauche es.
EN_transcript: This silly boy doesn't really want it, and I really do.

DE_transcript: Du weißt, das Bild gehört dir, Dorian.
EN_transcript: You know the picture is yours, Dorian.

EN_transcript: I gave it to you before it existed.

EN_transcript: And you know you have been a little silly, Mr. Gray, and that you don't really object to being reminded that you are extremely young.

EN_transcript: I should have objected very strongly this morn ing, Lord Henry.

EN_transcript: Ah I this morning You have lived since then.

EN_transcript: There was a rattle of cups and saucers and the hissing of a fluted Georgian urn.

EN_transcript: The two men sauntered languidly to the table, and examined what was under the covers.

EN_transcript: Let us go to the theatre tonight, said Lord Henry.

EN_transcript: There is sure to be something on, some where.

EN_transcript: I have promised to dine at White's, but it is only with an old friend, so I can send him a wire to say that I am ill, or that I am prevented from coming in consequence of a subsequent engagement.

EN_transcript: I think that would be a rather nice excuse : it would have all the surprise of candour.

EN_transcript: The one who is pouring out tea for us, or the one in the picture ?

EN_transcript: Before either.

EN_transcript: Then you shall come; and you will come too, Basil, won't you ?

EN_transcript: I can't really.

EN_transcript: I would sooner not.

EN_transcript: I shall stay with the real Dorian, he said, sadly.

EN_transcript: Am I really like that ?
